poem:
**Commons to Comedy**

Mhairi, youngest bold,
From benches to mic stand,
Parliament's tales unfold
In laughter's healing hand.

Policies woven in jest,
Nine years, burdens lightened,
Now, her heart finds rest,
In every joy heightened.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mhairi Black: Politics Isn’t For Me review – ex-youngest MP trades Commons for comedy therapy You can see why, having quit as an SNP MP after nine years in parliament, Mhairi Black’s first move is on to the standup stage. Goodness me, she has a story to tell! No one else’s 20s were quite like this – from becoming our youngest MP since the 1832 Reform Act, at the height of the independence surge, via". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
